definition: to go around in circles/to make a detour/(fig.) to beat about the bush
variant of 繞|绕[rao4], to rotate around/to spiral/to move around/to go round (an obstacle)/to by-pass/to make a detour
to wind/to coil (thread)/to rotate around/to spiral/to move around/to go round (an obstacle)/to by-pass/to make a detour/to confuse/to perplex
to confine/to lock up/to pen in
pen (pig)/a fold
circle/ring/loop/classifier for loops, orbits, laps of race etc/CL:個|个[ge4]/to surround/to circle
(noun suffix)

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: The circle seemed to portray the deliberations of the young man.
sentences.chinese: 绕圈子似乎在描绘年轻人的深思熟虑。

sentences.english: The birds circled around in the air.

definition: to encircle/to go around/to circle/to beat about the bush
lit. to go on a long detour/fig. to speak vaguely around the topic without getting to the point/to beat about the bush
lit. going round the curves and skirting the corners (idiom)/fig. to speak in a roundabout way/to equivocate/to beat about the bush
see 拐彎抹角|拐弯抹角[guai3 wan1 mo4 jiao3]
meandering and circuitous (idiom); to go around in circles and never get anywhere
to go for a walk around/fig. to speak in a roundabout way
bend/turn/curve
to talk in riddles
not to mince words/not to beat about the bush
pinyin: da3 kai1 tian1 chuang1 shuo1 liang4 hua4

definition: lit. to open the door and see the mountain; fig. to get right to the point (idiom)
to talk about this and that (idiom); to ramble incoherently
incorrect variant of 囉嗦|啰嗦[luo1 suo5]
to play dumb/to slack off (idiom)
see 直截了當|直截了当[zhi2 jie2 liao3 dang4]
to argue needlessly/to waste time explaining
direct and plainspoken (idiom); blunt/straightforward
